data.title: U2: Hear New Song 'Atomic City'
data.meta_description: U2 has released "Atomic City," their new single written in tribute to Las Vegas, which is the location of their "U2:UV" residency.
data.text:
U2 has released “Atomic City,” their new single written in tribute to Las Vegas, which is the location of their “U2:UV” residency that kicks off September 29.

The video for the new song is below. It harkens back to the band’s classic video for “I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For,” which was also filmed on Freemont Street in Las Vegas in 1987. The video is also reminiscent of the clip for “All Because of You,” which also saw the band perform on a flatbed truck through the streets of New York.

“Atomic City” is available for streaming and download here.

As previously reported, the video for “Atomic City” was filmed on September 16. Variety noted that 250 extras were recruited for the video.

Despite not taking part in the residency, drummer Larry Mullen Jr. took part in the recording of “Atomic City” and its accompanying video. Mullen Jr. shared in November 2022 that he needs surgery due to the wear and tear of drumming for decades. Bram van den Berg will be filling in for him during the residency.

U2’s highly anticipated Vegas kicks off tonight (September 29) at the new MSG Sphere. A full list of residency dates is below.

U2: Their 50 Best Songs, Ranked

U2 has been one of the biggest bands of the past 50 years and for good reason: Their catalog is a prime example of a band evolving and growing up before the eyes of the world.

Scroll through the list below to see which songs we think are their 50 best!

Erica Banas is a news blogger who's been covering the rock/classic rock world since 2014. The coolest event she's ever covered in person was the 2021 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony. (Sir Paul McCartney inducting Foo Fighters? C'mon now!) She's also well-versed in etiquette and extraordinarily nice. #TransRightsAreHumanRights
